title: Revert "MSBuild Upgrade: netstandard2.0 -> net6.0 (#6148)"
body:
This reverts commit 9c173296404f9c365cc524569766f16d7cfcf308.

Let's revert the net6.0 upgrade to give us time to flow other PR's. If kitten handoff happens 1 week early, next kitten may be able to figure out https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/24258/ before reverting.

commit.message:
Revert "MSBuild Upgrade: netstandard2.0 -> net6.0 (#6148)"

This reverts commit 9c173296404f9c365cc524569766f16d7cfcf308.

nodes.body: If we revert this, it should at least wait to see just how many failures come out of https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/24258/. A lot of the failures I was seeing was due to mismatched bits, and after cleaning it was still not able to download packages from a specific URL.
